description.detailed_html:
Derive from this interface if the ProcessorEventHandler is uninterested in user exceptions.

The ProcessorEventHandler user exception interface performs symbol demangling which is relatively expensive. Many ProcessorEventHandlers are uninterested in user exceptions which results in that work being discarded.

description.detailed_html:
Called before postRead, after reading arguments (server) / after reading reply (client), with the actual (unparsed, serialized) data.

The data is framed by message begin / end entries, call readMessageBegin / readMessageEnd on the protocol.

Only called for Cpp2.

overloadsets.brief_html: Called before postRead, after reading arguments (server) / after reading reply (client), with the actual (unparsed, serialized) data.

description.detailed_html: Called when an interaction is terminated (not necessarily part of a thrift request, unlike the other callbacks). Must override wantNonPerRequestCallbacks to true to receive callbacks.

overloadsets.brief_html: Called when an interaction is terminated (not necessarily part of a thrift request, unlike the other callbacks). Must override wantNonPerRequestCallbacks to true to receive callbacks.

definition.simple_html: virtual bool wantNonPerRequestCallbacks() const
definition.simple_raw: virtual bool wantNonPerRequestCallbacks() const
definition.detailed_html: inline virtual bool wantNonPerRequestCallbacks() const
definition.detailed_raw: inline virtual bool wantNonPerRequestCallbacks() const

description.detailed_html:
defaults to false.

When false, getContext is only called as part of a thrift request (meaning typically has a connection + header + folly::RequestContext available etc). When true, getContext is also called as part of a non-thrift request, such as interaction terminate. Impl must init/free contexts without assuming the existence of per-request objects like header / folly::RequestContext.
